post_message: It was not art, but necessity that first helped popularize absinthe: It was included in the rations of French soldiers who marched off to colonize Algeria in the 1840s, issued "for the prevention of fevers and treatment of dysentery."  It was only later that drinking absinthe came to be viewed as an indulgence for both the eyes and the tongue.
